hints.content:
[[☃ image 1]]

There are $9$ people at the party and each paid $\$10$.

We can multiply to find the cost for the people at the party. 

The cost for the party guests is $9\times\$10=\$\blueD{90}$.

options.alt: A rectangle divided into two unequal parts. The first part is  bigger than the second part. The first part is labeled 90 and Group cost and has a curved bracket across the bottom labeled 9 times 10. The second part is labeled Cake and has a curved bracket across the bottom labeled with a question mark. A curved bracket below the entire rectangle is labeled 120. !

hints.content:
$\greenD{\text{Total}}$ cost of the party $-$ costs of the $\blueD{\text{guests}}$ $=$ cost of the  $\maroonD{\text{cake}}$. 



$\greenD{120}-\blueD{90}=\maroonD{30}$

question.content:
It costs $\$120$ to have a party for $9$ people at the skating rink. The cost includes a charge of $\$10$ for each person attending the party plus the price of a cake.

**How much does the cake cost?**    

$\$$ [[☃ input-number 1]]
